title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 272.1 - Applications and necessary documents
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 272.1 - Applications and necessary documents

State Regulations

All applications for a license to remove sand, gravel
and/or other materials from State-owned lands under water pursuant to
subdivision 5 of section
3
of the Public

Lands Law shall be in the form of a letter addressed to the Commissioner of

General Services, Albany, New York, Attention: Bureau of Surplus Real Property. Each application must set forth: the full and complete name and address of the
applicant; the full name of the dredge to be involved in connection with the
license being sought; the port of registry or home port of such dredge; the
full and complete name and address of the owner or owners of such dredge; and
the area to be dredged. With each application there must be submitted a
duplicate of any permit required for the proposed dredging, by the U.S. Department of the Army, Corps of Engineers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
272.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
